text: Sechs Kies is a South Korean boy band formed in 1997 with six members by Daesung Enterprise (DSP Media) in order to top H.O.T. The group is known today as one of the founding groups of K-pop and for being the first major group to break up. In 2016, the members (excluding Jiyong,) joined YG Entertainment and released the song "Three Words". After a series of collection albums, the group released the album, Another Light, in 2017, nearly 17 years since breaking up. ==Discography== ===Albums=== *School Byolgeok (1997) *Welcome to the Sechskies Land (1997) *Road Fighter (1998) *Com'Back (1999) *Another Light (2017) ===Mini-albums=== *Special (1999) ===Compiliations=== *1020 Mix (1999) *Blue Note (2000) *2016 Re-ALBUM (2016) *The 20th Anniversary (2017) ===Non- album singles=== *Thanks (2000) Category:1990s South Korean music groups Category:1997 establishments in South Korea Category:2000s disestablishments in South Korea Category:2000 disestablishments in Asia Category:2000s South Korean music groups Category:2010s South Korean music groups Category:2016 establishments in South Korea Category:2020s disestablishments in South Korea Category:2020s South Korean music groups Category:2021 disestablishments in Asia Category:K-pop music groups Category:Musical groups disestablished in 2000 Category:Musical groups disestablished in the 2020s Category:Musical groups established in 1997 Category:Musical groups established in 2016 Category:South Korean boy bands Category:YG Entertainment artists
title: Sechs Kies
